Initial Core Idea from ROT (partial): Austin is considered a naive empiricist because his account of law is based on an anachronistic model of a legal system. His reliance on the 19th-century English legal system, a system already undergoing significant changes, led him to develop a theory that was overly focused on command and sanctions. This narrow focus prevented him from appreciating the historical development of law, the diverse forms it takes in different societies, and the ways in which law interacts with social, cultural, and political contexts beyond the specific model he studied. His empiricism was "naive" because it failed to adequately account for the complexities and evolutions inherent in legal systems....
